text: At 08:29:09 EDT on 14 August 2021, a magnitude 7.2 earthquake hit the Tiburon Peninsula in Haiti on the island of Hispaniola. It had a -deep hypocenter near Petit-Trou-de-Nippes. It happened about west of the capital, Port-au-Prince. It caused tsunami warnings for the Haitian coast. Over 300 people died and at least 1,800 people were injured. It is the deadliest earthquake of 2021. Prime Minister Ariel Henry declared a state of emergency because of the large number of deaths and the severe damage. ==References== ==Related pages== *2010 Haiti earthquake Category:2021 disasters in North America Category:2020s in Haiti Category:August 2021 events Category:2021 earthquakes 2021
title: 2021 Haiti earthquake
